Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: The student can draw a plant that looks healthy, perhaps with green leaves, but may not fully depict the optimal health due to water (some details like vibrant color might be inconsistent).
The student can draw a plant that looks unhealthy, possibly with drooping leaves or a wilted appearance, indicating lack of water.
The student can illustrate a basic difference between the appearance of plants with water and plants without water, though it might be somewhat simplistic or lacking in detail.
CANNOT: The student may not consistently include elements that show the need for light, such as a sun or lamp (might forget or misplace these elements).
The student might struggle to label the parts of the plant, such as roots, stem, and leaves, or might mislabel them (student may confuse parts of the plant).
The student might not clearly show roots absorbing water from soil, or they might forget to depict this aspect at all (student doesnâ€™t recognize this process).
